column3: Untested ACK, but please don't change the indentation.\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4823_ea1e4fe3ac1aa5a5421e864d67b3201b915be041/ for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-te
Shouldn't this be ssize_t instead of long?\n
This needs testing to ensure we are returning the proper result.  What input data will achieve this?  cc @theuni\n
fseek defined with long. I don't see much reason to invent something new there\n
My aversion against long is that it is 64-bit on win64 and 32-bit on 64-bit linux and osx. But indeed, as `fseek` takes a long it makes sense here.\n

We can enumerate the possible values of `vch.size()` 1..nMaxNumSize and see if it can produce a cast with undefined behavior (where the sign bit is set)

```
vch.size() | max result       | mask             | max casted value 
-----------|------------------|------------------|------------------
 1         | 00000000000000ff | ffffffffffffff7f | 000000000000007f
 2         | 000000000000ffff
